Body: Possible Duplicate:  How can I fix the GPS on my Samsung Galaxy S?  I've got a Samsung GT-I9000 (SGS1), it was on a pretty old stock firmware. I upgraded and rooted it with Odin and installed CyanogenMod 9 and the Icy-Glitch Kernel.However I can't get any GPS signal, if I'm in Google Maps it keeps saying something like "Searching for GPS" (original on German "GPS wird gesucht").I know that it did work with the old firmware when I got it.What can I do to get the GPS back working?
Title: Why GPS is never found?

history.Text: i've got a Samsung GT-I9000 (SGS1), it was on a pretty old stock firmware. I upgraded and rooted it with Odin and installed CyanogenMod 9 (http://download.cyanogenmod.com/?type=stable&device=galaxysmtd) and the Icy-Glitch (http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?t=1459576) Kernel.However I can't get any GPS signal, if I'm in Google Maps it keeps saying something like "Searching for GPS" (orginal on german "GPS wird gesucht")I know that it did work when i got it (with the old firmware)What can i do to get the GPS back working?

history.Comment: Improved the question readability! Improved the title and fixed some minor grammar issues. Removed device-specific tag.
history.Text: I've got a Samsung GT-I9000 (SGS1), it was on a pretty old stock firmware. I upgraded and rooted it with Odin and installed [CyanogenMod 9][1] and the [Icy-Glitch][2] Kernel.However I can't get any GPS signal, if I'm in Google Maps it keeps saying something like "Searching for GPS" (original on German "GPS wird gesucht").I know that it did work with the old firmware when I got it.What can I do to get the GPS back working?  [1]: http://download.cyanogenmod.com/?type=stable&device=galaxysmtd  [2]: http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?t=1459576
